Row.Text: {1_Playername}'s Palace has been blown up by religious dissidents!
Their capital has entered [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Gunpowder Plot

A man of a minority faith has come forward, confessing his involvement in a plot to blow up the Palace. He begs for repentence, but doesn't know enough to bring down the plotters.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]What should we do, Your Excellence?
50% chance for {5_Turns} turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Convert 60% of followers to your Religion, but lose -2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness for 15 turns.
Spend {2_InstantYield} in return for +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on the Palace.

If anything happens to that building, the only thing that will be different, the only thing that will change, the only difference that it will make, is that next turn instead of a notification, I will be reading your resignation!
Offer this man, and any others who want to come forward, a pardon. Then, burn every remaining member of that misbegotten faith at the stake.
Those ungrateful muts. Pull every reserve to search for these conspirators. Double the guard. Cancel Christmas.
Clean out the palace. When the explosion comes, tell everyone it was part of the WTLKD celebrations. Then, build a bigger, better Palace.
Notorious Pirate
A notorious pirate is known to spend his time ashore in one of our Harbor's taverns. His presence is attracting a slew of undiserables.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]So far, no one has been able to catch him.
Certainly no pirate I've ever heard of. Send some Navy official to deal with this, what's the worse that could happen?
I've heard much of this sailor's exploits. Send an agent to present him with this letter of marque.
Though the local fishermen may not like it, I can see the benefits of having a legendary tavern.
They say this man hordes his fortune in a rare type of Pearl. It would be unfortunate if someone were to... commandeer it.
{5_Turns} of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Rioting.
Spend 400 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to gain a Corvette.
For {5_Turns} the Harbor gains +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism, but nearby Fishing Boats lose -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Up to 2 Fishing Boats and the Harbor are destroyed. A [ICON_WAR] Barbarian Unit spawns. Gain a copy of the [ICON_RES_PEARLS] Pearls resource.
Black Market
The authorities have intercepted a small scale operation smuggling contraband into the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Governor thinks they might be of use...
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Lose {2_InstantYield} Golden Age Points. The threshold for [ICON_STRENGTH] Crime is permentantly reduced by 10%.
The Constabulary gains +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Gain 10 turns of WLTKD in the city.
No deals. The law is clear on their punishment.
Talk of corruption in my very presence?! I am the law. Find me a new Governor, and hang the old one beside these criminals.
I agree. There will always be crime; it would be useful to have friends on the other side of the law.
Banning these goods is, I think, a little old-fashioned. Pardon the smugglers and legalise these products.
The City of {2_CityName} has succumbed to an horrific viral outbreak.
The [ICON_CITIZEN] Population of {2_CityName} has fallen by 5!
The City of {2_CityName} is fighting an horrific viral outbreak.
The City of {2_CityName} has lost 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, but researchers are working on a cure!
Viral Outbreak
The city has been gripped by the deadly Motaba virus. At this time, there is no available treatment. We must prepare for the worst.
Lose 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Lose 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and 2000 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, but become immune to such events in the future.
Quarantine is the only option we have available.
Give the Medical Lab anything they need. We need to have an answer before this thing strikes again.
Research efforts after the recent outbreak have secured a cure to the Motaba Virus.
Cure Discovered!
The City of {2_CityName}'s Oil Wells have malfunctioned.
An Oil Well has exploded!
Explosion at the Oil Field
An [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil Well is destroyed.
Motaba Virus

Our military intelligence has brought in a babbling medic, who claims to have discovered an incredibly dangerous virus while doing charity work in one of the far-flung corners of the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Only this man's research need make it to our Science Advisor...
Enemy cities experience biological terrorism.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. Your cities become immune to biological terrorism.
Gain 2 Guided Missiles in every city.
Your Aircraft gain the Air Siege III promotion.
Get me the head of CI:6. I'm authorising the use of this virus against civilian populations.
What are you talking about?! This is horrifying. Send the Doctor to our best Medical Lab, we need to be prepared should this thing ever break loose!
This is just what the boys over at prototype weapons have been looking for. Green light the Scud Storm project.
We can't trust something like this to those nutjobs over in RnD. Get me the Airforce.
A report has shown that the recently-constructed trans-continental pipeline was built with major structural flaws.
All [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil Wells are vulnerable to malfunction while an investigation takes place.
In the Pipeline
One of our operatives has attained a high ranking position in a foreign Oil company.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we use our asset?
Gain +4 [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil. Customs Houses increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold in Cities by 10%.
Temporarily, Foreign [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil resources will be likely to explode.
Gain the Refridgeration technology.
With influence over trading, we should be able to make sure some of that [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil finds its way to our ports.
The asset is well-placed to conduct a strategic piece of industrial espionage.
His report details plans for the construction of large off-shore platforms. Get me those schematics!
